intro: Caryophyllata vulgaris, commonly known as the common carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, white, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardening and have a mild, spicy scent. Caryophyllata vulgaris is native to Europe and parts of Asia but is now cultivated worldwide for its aesthetic and aromatic qualities.
